result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Joseph Robert Ladd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Justin Joseph Robert Ladd is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Justin Joseph Robert Ladd was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- If Defendant pays Court ordered financial obligations by 10/03/22. Court will vacate Probation and jail sentence. If Defendant fails to pay financial obligations by 10/03/22. Defendant will have to sign up for Probation.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

2:23 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Justin Joseph Robert Ladd. Defendant Justin Joseph Robert Ladd appeared by video. Court reviews case. ADA Ballo recites resolution. Court finds Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to personal appearance for today's proceeding. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count 2: Misdemeanor Retail Theft- 943.50(1m)(b). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses Count 1. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:

Count 2: W/S 1 year Probation 

- 60 days conditional time- Stayed 
- Fine: $100.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court by 10/03/22
- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court by 10/03/22
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court by 10/03/22

Other Conditions:
- DNA Sample 
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested 

If DE pays Court ordered financial obligations by 10/03/22, Court will vacate Probation and Jail sentence. If defendant fails to pay financial obligations by 10/03/22 Defendant will have to sign up for probation.
